  • Next wordê°€ ë¬´ì—‡ì¸ì§€ ì˜ˆì¸¡í•˜ëŠ” Task
  • ê³µì‹ì  ì •ì˜
    • Words sequence x(1),x(2),â€¦,x(t)x^{(1)}, x^{(2)}, \dots, x^{(t)}x(1),x(2),â€¦,x(t)ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì¡Œì„ ë•Œ, Next word x(t+1)x^{(t+1)}x(t+1)ì˜ Probability distribution ê³„ì‚°

P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(1))P(x^{(t+1)}|x^{(t)}, \dots, x^{(1)}) P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(1))

  • ì´ë¥¼ ìˆ˜í–‰í•˜ëŠ” Systemì„ Language Modelì´ë¼ ì§€ì¹­

P(x(1),â€¦,x(T))P(x^{(1)}, \dots, x^{(T)}) P(x(1),â€¦,x(T))

=P(x(1))Ã—P(x(2)âˆ£x(1))Ã—â‹¯Ã—P(X(T)âˆ£x(Tâˆ’1),Â â€¦,x(1))= P(x^{(1)}) \times P(x^{(2)}|x^{(1)}) \times \dots \times P(X^{(T)}| x^{(T-1)} , ~\dots ,x^{(1)}) =P(x(1))Ã—P(x(2)âˆ£x(1))Ã—â‹¯Ã—P(X(T)âˆ£x(Tâˆ’1),Â â€¦,x(1))

=âˆt=1TP(x(t)âˆ£x(t)âˆ£x(tâˆ’1),Â â€¦,x(1))= \prod_{t=1} ^T P(x^{(t)}|x^{(t)} | x ^{(t-1)},~ \dots, x ^ {(1)}) =t=1âˆTâ€‹P(x(t)âˆ£x(t)âˆ£x(tâˆ’1),Â â€¦,x(1))

NNN-Gram Language Models

  • Deep learning ì´ì „ì˜ ê·¼ë³¸ì ì´ê³  ê³ ì „ì ì¸ Language Model êµ¬í˜„ ë°©ì‹
  • NNN-gram: nnnê°œì˜ ì—°ì†ì ì¸ words ë©ì–´ë¦¬
    • Unigrams: "the", "students"
    • Bigrams: "the students", "student opened"
    • Trigrams: "the students opened", "students opened their"
    • Four-grams: "the students opened their"
  • Idea: ë¹ˆë„ í†µê³„ë¥¼ ìˆ˜ì§‘í•˜ì—¬ next word ì˜ˆì¸¡ì— í™œìš©

  • Markov assumption
    • x(t+1)x^{(t+1)}x(t+1)ì€ ì˜¤ì§ ì•ì„  nâˆ’1n-1nâˆ’1ê°œì˜ wordsì—ë§Œ ì˜ì¡´í•œë‹¤ê³  ê°€ì •

P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(1))=P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(tâˆ’n+2))P(x^{(t+1)}|x^{(t)}, \dots, x^{(1)}) = P(x^{(t+1)}|x^{(t)}, \dots, x^{(t-n+2)}) P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(1))=P(x(t+1)âˆ£x(t),â€¦,x(tâˆ’n+2))

=P(x(t+1),x(t),Â â€¦,Â x(tâˆ’n+2))P(x(t),Â â€¦,Â x(tâˆ’n+2))= \frac{P(x^{(t+1)}, x^{(t)},~\dots,~x^{(t-n+2)})}{P(x^{(t)},~\dots,~x^{(t - n + 2)})} =P(x(t),Â â€¦,Â x(tâˆ’n+2))P(x(t+1),x(t),Â â€¦,Â x(tâˆ’n+2))â€‹

  • Large corpus(ëŒ€ê·œëª¨ ì–¸ì–´ ì§‘í•©)ì—ì„œ ê°œìˆ˜ë¥¼ ì„¸ì–´(Counting) í™•ë¥  ê³„ì‚°(Statistical approximation)
    • Count ratioë¥¼ í†µí•´ ì¡°ê±´ë¶€ í™•ë¥  ê·¼ì‚¬

NNN-Gram Language Models: Example

  • 4-gram Language Model í•™ìŠµì˜ ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ ê°€ì •
  • as the proctor started the clock, the students opened their ______

P(wâˆ£studentsÂ openedÂ their)=count(studentsÂ openedÂ theirÂ w)count(studentsÂ openedÂ their)P(w|\text{students opened their})=\frac{\text{count}(\text{students opened their}~w)}{\text{count}(\text{students opened their})} P(wâˆ£studentsÂ openedÂ their)=count(studentsÂ openedÂ their)count(studentsÂ openedÂ theirÂ w)â€‹

  • Corpus ë‚´ "students opened their" ë’¤ì— ì˜¤ëŠ” ë‹¨ì–´ë“¤ì˜ ë¹ˆë„ë¥¼ í™•ì¸í•˜ì—¬ í™•ë¥  ë¶€ì—¬
    • "books": (0.4)(0.4)(0.4)
    • "exams": (0.1)(0.1)(0.1)

Neural Language Models

Based on feed-forward NNs and RNNs

A (Fixed-Window) Neural Language Model

  • Output distribution

y^=softmax(Uh+b2)âˆˆRâˆ£Vâˆ£\hat{\bm{y}}=\text{softmax}(\bm{Uh} + \bm{b_2} ) \in \mathbb{R}^{|V|} y^â€‹=softmax(Uh+b2â€‹)âˆˆRâˆ£Vâˆ£

  • Hidden layer

h=f(We+b1)\bm{h} = f(\bm{We+b_1}) h=f(We+b1â€‹)

  • Concatenated word embeddings

e=[e(1);Â e(2);Â e(3);Â e(4)]\bm{e}=[\bm{e}^{(1)};~\bm{e}^{(2)};~\bm{e}^{(3)};~\bm{e}^{(4)}] e=[e(1);Â e(2);Â e(3);Â e(4)]

  • Words / One-hot vectors

x(1),Â x(2),Â x(3),Â x(4)\bm{x}^{(1)},~\bm{x}^{(2)},~\bm{x}^{(3)},~\bm{x}^{(4)} x(1),Â x(2),Â x(3),Â x(4)

  • Yoshua Bengio et al. (2000)ì´ ì œì•ˆí•œ ì´ˆê¸° ë²„ì „
  • NNN-gram Language Model ëŒ€ë¹„ ê°œì„ ì 
    • Sparsity problem(í¬ì†Œì„± ë¬¸ì œ) ì—†ìŒ
    • ê´€ì¸¡ëœ ëª¨ë“  NNN-gramsë¥¼ ì €ì¥í•  í•„ìš” ì—†ìŒ
  • ë‚¨ì€ ë¬¸ì œì 
    • Fixed window í¬ê¸°ê°€ ë„ˆë¬´ ì‘ìŒ
    • Window í¬ê¸°ë¥¼ ëŠ˜ë¦¬ë©´ weights WWWê°€ ì»¤ì§
    • x(1)x^{(1)}x(1)ê³¼ x(2)x^{(2)}x(2)ê°€ ì„œë¡œ ì™„ì „íˆ ë‹¤ë¥¸ weights WWWì— ê³±í•´ì§ (ë¹„ëŒ€ì¹­ì„±)
  • ì„ì˜ì˜ ê¸¸ì´ì˜ inputì„ ì²˜ë¦¬í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” neural architecture í•„ìš”ì„± ëŒ€ë‘

Training an RNN Language Model

  • ì ˆì°¨
    • Words sequenceë¡œ êµ¬ì„±ëœ big corpus ì¤€ë¹„
    • RNN-LMì— ì…ë ¥í•˜ì—¬ ë§¤ step tttë§ˆë‹¤ output distribution y^(t)\hat{\bm{y}}^{(t)}y^â€‹(t) ê³„ì‚°
  • Loss function
    • ì˜ˆì¸¡ëœ í™•ë¥ ë¶„í¬ y^(t)\hat{\bm{y}}^{(t)}y^â€‹(t)ì™€ ì‹¤ì œ ë‹¤ìŒ ë‹¨ì–´ y(t)\bm{y}^{(t)}y(t) (One-hot) ê°„ì˜ Cross-entropy

J(t)(Î¸)=CE(y(t),y^(t))=âˆ’âˆ‘wâˆˆVyw(t)logâ¡y^w(t)=âˆ’logâ¡y^x(t+1)(t)J^{(t)}(\theta) = CE(\bm{y}^{(t)}, \hat{\bm{y}}^{(t)}) = -\sum_{w \in V} \bm{y}_w^{(t)} \log \hat{\bm{y}}_w^{(t)} = -\log \hat{\bm{y}}_{x^{(t+1)}}^{(t)} J(t)(Î¸)=CE(y(t),y^â€‹(t))=âˆ’wâˆˆVâˆ‘â€‹yw(t)â€‹logy^â€‹w(t)â€‹=âˆ’logy^â€‹x(t+1)(t)â€‹

  • ì „ì²´ training setì— ëŒ€í•´ Average loss ê³„ì‚°

J(Î¸)=1Tâˆ‘t=1Tâˆ’logâ¡y^xt+1tJ(\theta)= \frac{1}{T} \sum _{t=1} ^T - \log \hat{\bm{y}} ^{t} _{x_{t+1}} J(Î¸)=T1â€‹t=1âˆ‘Tâ€‹âˆ’logy^â€‹xt+1â€‹tâ€‹

  • ì „ì²´ corpusì— ëŒ€í•´ í•œ ë²ˆì— lossì™€ gradientsë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì€ ë¹„ìš©ì´ ê³¼ë‹¤í•¨

J(Î¸)=1Tâˆ‘t=1TJ(t)(Î¸)J(\theta) = \frac{1}{T} \sum_{t=1} ^{T} J^{(t)} (\theta) J(Î¸)=T1â€‹t=1âˆ‘Tâ€‹J(t)(Î¸)

  • ì‹¤ì œë¡œëŠ” x(1),â€¦,x(T)x^{(1)}, \dots, x^{(T)}x(1),â€¦,x(T)ë¥¼ sentence (ë˜ëŠ” document) ë‹¨ìœ„ë¡œ ì²˜ë¦¬
  • Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD)ë¥¼ í™œìš©í•˜ì—¬ ì‘ì€ chunk (Batch) ë°ì´í„°ì— ëŒ€í•´ loss ë° gradient ê³„ì‚° í›„ weights update ë°˜ë³µ

Recurrent Neural Networks for Other Applications

Tagging, classification, question answering, speech recognition

RNNs Can Be Used for Tagging

  • ì˜ˆ: Part-of-speech tagging, Named Entity Recognition ë“±

RNNs Can Be Used for Sentence Classification

  • ì˜ˆ: Sentiment classification(ê°ì • ë¶„ì„) ë“±

RNN-LMs Can Be Used to Generate Text

  • Speech recognition, Machine translation, Summarization ë“±

  • í•´ë‹¹ ì€ë‹‰ ìƒíƒœë¥¼ ë¬¸ì¥ ë‚´ì˜ "terribly"ë¼ëŠ” ë‹¨ì–´ì˜ ë¬¸ë§¥ì  í‘œí˜„ìœ¼ë¡œ ê°„ì£¼ ê°€ëŠ¥
    • ì´ê²ƒì„ contextual representation(ë¬¸ë§¥ì  í‘œí˜„)ì´ë¼ê³  ë¶€ë¦„.
  • ì´ëŸ¬í•œ ë¬¸ë§¥ì  í‘œí˜„ì€ ì™¼ìª½ ë¬¸ë§¥(ì˜ˆ: "the movie was")ì— ëŒ€í•œ ì •ë³´ë§Œì„ í¬í•¨
  • ì´ ì˜ˆì‹œì—ì„œ, "exciting"ì€ ì˜¤ë¥¸ìª½ ë¬¸ë§¥ì— ìˆìœ¼ë©° ì´ê²ƒì´ "terribly"ì˜ ì˜ë¯¸ë¥¼ ìˆ˜ì •í•˜ê³  ìˆìŒ (ë¶€ì •ì—ì„œ ê¸ì •ìœ¼ë¡œ).

Long Short-Term Memory RNNs (LSTMs)

  • 1997ë…„ Hochreiterì™€ Schmidhuberê°€ vanishing gradients problemì˜ í•´ê²°ì±…ìœ¼ë¡œ ì œì•ˆí•œ RNNì˜ ì¼ì¢…
  • Inputs sequence x(t)x^{(t)}x(t)ê°€ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ë©´ hidden states sequence h(t)h^{(t)}h(t)ì™€ cell states c(t)c^{(t)}c(t)ë¥¼ ê³„ì‚°
  • Timestep tttì—ì„œì˜ ê³¼ì •
  • Forget gate: ì´ì „ cell stateì—ì„œ ìœ ì§€í•  ê²ƒê³¼ ìŠì„ ê²ƒì„ ì œì–´

f(t)=Ïƒ(Wfh(tâˆ’1)+Ufx(t)+bf)f^{(t)} = \sigma(W_f h^{(t-1)} + U_f x^{(t)} + b_f) f(t)=Ïƒ(Wfâ€‹h(tâˆ’1)+Ufâ€‹x(t)+bfâ€‹)

  • Input gate: ìƒˆë¡œìš´ cell content ì¤‘ ì–´ë–¤ ë¶€ë¶„ì„ cellì— ê¸°ë¡í• ì§€ ì œì–´

i(t)=Ïƒ(Wih(tâˆ’1)+Uix(t)+bi)i^{(t)} = \sigma(W_i h^{(t-1)} + U_i x^{(t)} + b_i) i(t)=Ïƒ(Wiâ€‹h(tâˆ’1)+Uiâ€‹x(t)+biâ€‹)

  • Output gate: cellì˜ ì–´ë–¤ ë¶€ë¶„ì„ hidden stateë¡œ ì¶œë ¥í• ì§€ ì œì–´

o(t)=Ïƒ(Woh(tâˆ’1)+Uox(t)+bo)o^{(t)} = \sigma(W_o h^{(t-1)} + U_o x^{(t)} + b_o) o(t)=Ïƒ(Woâ€‹h(tâˆ’1)+Uoâ€‹x(t)+boâ€‹)

(Sigmoid function: ëª¨ë“  gate ê°’ì€ 0ê³¼ 1 ì‚¬ì´)

  • New cell content: cellì— ê¸°ë¡ë  ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ë‚´ìš©

c~(t)=tanhâ¡(Wch(tâˆ’1)+Ucx(t)+bc)\tilde{c}^{(t)} = \tanh(W_c h^{(t-1)} + U_c x^{(t)} + b_c) c~(t)=tanh(Wcâ€‹h(tâˆ’1)+Ucâ€‹x(t)+bcâ€‹)

  • Cell state: ì´ì „ cell stateì—ì„œ ì¼ë¶€ ë‚´ìš©ì„ ì§€ìš°ê³ ("forget"), ìƒˆë¡œìš´ cell contentë¥¼ ì¼ë¶€ ê¸°ë¡("input")

c(t)=f(t)âˆ˜c(tâˆ’1)+i(t)âˆ˜c~(t)c^{(t)} = f^{(t)} \circ c^{(t-1)} + i^{(t)} \circ \tilde{c}^{(t)} c(t)=f(t)âˆ˜c(tâˆ’1)+i(t)âˆ˜c~(t)

  • Hidden state: cellì—ì„œ ì¼ë¶€ ë‚´ìš©ì„ ì½ìŒ("output")

h(t)=o(t)âˆ˜tanhâ¡c(t)h^{(t)} = o^{(t)} \circ \tanh c^{(t)} h(t)=o(t)âˆ˜tanhc(t)

  • ì°¸ê³  ì‚¬í•­
    • ì´ë“¤ì€ ëª¨ë‘ ë™ì¼í•œ ê¸¸ì´ nnnì˜ vector
    • GatesëŠ” element-wise (ë˜ëŠ” Hadamard) product âˆ˜\circâˆ˜ë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì—¬ ì ìš©

Diagram Legend

  • (X): Pointwise Multiplication (Element-wise)
  • (+): Pointwise Addition (The "Secret" regarding gradients)
  • SIGMOID, TANH: Neural Network Layers (Activation Functions)
  • ->: Vector Transfer
  • Combine: Concatenation
